title: Filipino association seeks quake relief
author: Times South Bureau
text: Filipino association    seeks quake relief     FEDERAL WAY         The Filipino Association of Greater Federal Way is seeking donations to aid victims of the devastating July 16 Philippine earthquake that left 1,600 dead and 88,000 people homeless         The group has opened an account at Washington Mutual Savings Bank, 32000 Pacific Highway South, to collect money for relief supplies.         Donations can be made at the bank in care of ``Filipino Earthquake Relief,'' said Sally Ramos, president of the Filipino Association.         ``It's just devastating news for everybody,'' said Ramos, a Philippines native who learned only two days after the quake struck that her family was safe.              For information on the relief effort, donors can call Ramos at 927-4013.
